snippet.title: Dior, Longchamp and a glitzy new hotel
snippet.description: Dior, Longchamp and a glitzy new hotel

snippet.title: Afghan hospital guard kills 3 American doctors
snippet.description: An Afghan security guard opened fire on a group of foreign doctors at a Kabul hospital on Thursday morning, killing three American physicians and wounding a U.S. nurse, officials said.

snippet.title: Ducks' Robidas won't need surgery on broken leg
snippet.description: Anaheim Ducks defenseman Stephane Robidas is ready for another long rehab after breaking his right leg again. At least he will not need surgery this time.

snippet.title: Progressives take Manhattan, and many other U.S. cities
snippet.description: U.S. cities turn left and take their mayors along with them.

snippet.title: In the Loop: Cory Booker (D-Tinseltown)
snippet.description: The senator from New Jersey spends a lot of time on that other coast.

snippet.title: 4th grader sells pot in northern Colorado
snippet.description: School officials in northern Colorado are asking parents to take care with their newly legal recreational marijuana, after fourth graders were caught dealing the drug on an elementary school campus.

snippet.title: New social networks connect cooks and diners
snippet.description: If the latest development in culinary social media catches on, the trendiest restaurants may no longer be restaurants.

snippet.title: D.C. Animal Watch
snippet.description: Among cases handled by the Washington Humane Society and the Washington Animal Rescue League.

snippet.title: Gay business owners still face challenges
snippet.description: It happens a few times a year: A customer refuses to work with Dave Greenbaum because he's gay.

snippet.title: Indian film stars, Bollywood Oscars come to Fla.
snippet.description: The International Indian Film Academy is holding its annual awards ceremony in Tampa starting Wednesday.
